states,
there were certaine de-
puted to conferre againe w

me, and to learne what
I could signifie, astouching those demaundes, w
ch
were
made by her
Ma
tie
and proposed to M
r

e 15
of this moneth in yo
r
L. house in
London.
But declaring
unto them
that I had not
understood
whoe they were in
the particular pointes
they imparted them unto
them
me
, and signi-
fied w
t
all,
at for 9 or 10 shippes for 3 monethes re-
quired by her Ma
tie
they did not thinke
at
e contrey
would make any difficultie: nor for
e twentie thousand
weight of powder: but they could not comprehend, what
was meant by that point, wherein her Ma
tie
doth desire,
to be served of two monethes victuals for two thousand men.
For they doe presume,
at all kinde of victuals are more
abundant, and better cheape, and more ready for
at service,
in England then heere: and
at they
could
can
not well carie
for more then 3 monethes victuals. Againe they seemed
to mervaile,
at if it were intended,
at
e Fort before
Brest should be taken from
e Enemie, there was no
mention of munition, and
at for powder so smalle a quan-
titie was demaunded: for
at in these contreis they doe
make provision at
e lest, at
e siege of any place
at
is of importance, of two hundred thousand weight, and
of fivetie thousand
weight
onely
to serve for
e smalle shotte.
I could not tell w
at
to answear to any of these doubtes,
because I had receaved no commission about it, nor was
not
rashely
to conejcture at her Ma
ties
meaning: Howbeit per-
ceaving by their speeches,
at they
would not shrinke in any point but
were rather inclined,
to affourd a greater proportion of every thing demaun-
ded, then was mentioned by her Ma
tie
then to shrinke
in any point
, I solicited them in
at behalf
to extende
their aide as farre as they could
and
declar
ing
ing for
e rest
unto them
at

ch
